org.shared.image.filter

Class Filters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.shared.image.filter.Filters

  • public class Filters
extends Object
    A static utility class in support of two-dimensional filters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static RealArray[] createGradientKernels(int supportRadius)
      Creates a pair of x- and y-axis aligned DooG kernels for gradient calculations.
      static RealArray createPointSupport(int supportRadius)
      Creates a point support matrix.
      static RealArray createRotationMatrix(double theta)
      Creates the 2×2 rotation matrix
      -cos(θ) -sin(θ) -sin(θ) cos(θ).

      void      		 normalize(T array)
      Mutatively normalizes a RealArray by its L1 norm or, alternatively, a ComplexArray by its complex magnitudes.

      • normalize

        public static final <T extends AbstractArray<?,?,?,?>> void normalize(T array)
        Mutatively normalizes a RealArray by its L1 norm or, alternatively, a ComplexArray by its complex magnitudes.

      • createRotationMatrix

        public static final RealArray createRotationMatrix(double theta)
        Creates the 2×2 rotation matrix
        -cos(θ) -sin(θ) -sin(θ) cos(θ).
        Parameters:
        theta - the angle of rotation.
        Returns:
        the rotation matrix.

      • createGradientKernels

        public static final RealArray[] createGradientKernels(int supportRadius)
        Creates a pair of x- and y-axis aligned DooG kernels for gradient calculations.
        Parameters:
        supportRadius - the kernel support radius.
        Returns:
        the pair of kernels.

      • createPointSupport

        public static final RealArray createPointSupport(int supportRadius)
        Creates a point support matrix. The top row consists of x-coordinates, and the bottom row consists of y-coordinates. The points range in a square where the origin is at the center.
        Parameters:
        supportRadius - the support radius.
        Returns:
        the point support matrix.
